PERSONA:
Meet Harold Thompson, a 68-year-old White male living in Casper, Wyoming. Born in Idaho, Harold grew up in a small town and moved to Wyoming after marrying his high school sweetheart, Deborah. They have been married for 45 years and have two grown children who have moved out of the house. Harold and Deborah currently reside in a modest, single-story house they purchased in 1985, in a suburban neighborhood with a mix of retirees and young families.

Harold is a high school graduate, having attended Casper's Natrona County High School. After completing his education, he worked as a mechanic at a local garage for over 30 years before retiring at the age of 62. His income is derived from a combination of his retirement savings and Deborah's part-time job as a librarian at the local public library.

Harold's household income is around $12,500 per year, which is supplemented by Deborah's income of $18,000 per year. They have public health insurance coverage through Medicare, which helps cover their medical expenses. As a retiree, Harold's economic concerns revolve around managing his fixed income, maintaining his home, and ensuring that he and Deborah can afford healthcare and other living expenses.

Harold's daily routine involves tending to his garden, volunteering at the local animal shelter, and participating in community events. He is an avid outdoorsman and enjoys fishing and hunting in his free time. Harold's economic priorities include preserving social security benefits, reducing healthcare costs, and ensuring that his community remains affordable for retirees like himself.
